docs.snippet: ABOUT fifteen years ago Mr. Stoddard frightened us almost to death with a book called "The Rising Tide of Colour." It was an interesting argument that the brown and yellow men would soon dominate the globe. Since then Mr. Stoddard, along with the...
docs.lead_paragraph: ABOUT fifteen years ago Mr. Stoddard frightened us almost to death with a book called "The Rising Tide of Colour." It was an interesting argument that the brown and yellow men would soon dominate the globe. Since then Mr. Stoddard, along with the rest of us, has learned a good deal.
docs.abstract: Stoddard, Lothrop; Clashing Tides of Colour

headline.main: Lothrop Stoddard Reconsiders His Tide of Color; CLASHING TIDES OF COLOUR. By Lothrop Stoddard. 414 pp. New York: Charles Scribner's Sons. $3.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, May 21. -- Delegates of all twenty-one Pan-American republics will meet here on May 26 to inaugurate the Pan-American Commercial Conference, in a new endeavor to suppress some of the obstacles that impede inter-American trade.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, May 21. -- Delegates of all twenty-one Pan-American republics will meet here on May 26 to inaugurate the Pan-American Commercial Conference, in a new endeavor to suppress some of the obstacles that impede inter-American trade.

docs.snippet: The foreign exchange market was highly irregular last week. Sterling rose to a new high since last December, carrying the Scandinavian currencies with it, while the French franc was under pressure and sold down to the lowest in more than three...
docs.lead_paragraph: The foreign exchange market was highly irregular last week. Sterling rose to a new high since last December, carrying the Scandinavian currencies with it, while the French franc was under pressure and sold down to the lowest in more than three months. In the Continentals, the belga and Swiss franc were firm, but the Holland guilder lost ground. The lira was unchanged.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED MAY 25, 1935.
